elements.title: Coronation of the Virgin (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the six saints in the Coronation of the Virgin (pictured) by Piero del Pollaiuolo are "poised between ecstasy and migraine"?

elements.title: Ayala Hasson (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Israeli journalist Ayala Hasson is the first woman to head Channel 1's news division?

elements.title: Elihu Akin House (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the notorious gambler Richard Albert Canfield stayed in the Elihu Akin House for a summer when he was thirteen years old?

elements.title: Grace Wisnewski (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that New Zealand footballer Grace Wisnewski's bottom-ranked team upset the defending league champions when she scored what an A-League statistician called an "acrobatic" 99th-minute equalising goal?

elements.title: toroidal solenoid (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the toroidal solenoid was the first fusion-power device to be patented?

elements.title: José Mendieta (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that leading Sacaba's largest drivers' union was José Mendieta's second choice of career, after teaching?

elements.title: Little Darlings (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Melanie Golding's theory that changeling folklore was an attempt to explain postpartum psychosis inspired her horror novel Little Darlings?

elements.title: Etika (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a mural created to honor the late YouTuber Etika was added as a PokéStop in the mobile game Pokémon Go?
